workshops.name: Relational Engagement (Entry Level)
workshops.description: Practical tikanga, language, and engagement protocols for respectful relationships with Māori iwi, hapū and community stakeholders. Builds fluency and sustainable values-led partnerships through clear, staircased learning.

workshops.name: Pōwhiri & Whakatau Readiness (Intermediate)
workshops.description: An intermediate session preparing confident practitioners to participate authentically in formal Māori welcome ceremonies. Covers pōwhiri flow, roles, responsibilities and practical participation readiness.

workshops.name: Mana Motuhake in the Workplace (Advanced)
workshops.description: Advanced learning for experienced practitioners exploring self‑determination, autonomy and Indigenous authority in workplace settings. Deepens cultural confidence and leadership application.
workshops.audience: Senior leaders, HR, People & Culture, SLT/ELT

workshops.name: Pathways to Māori Relational Engagement (Marae - 3×90min)
workshops.description: Three 90‑minute sessions delivered in one day at a marae covering Relational Māori Engagement, Pōwhiri & Whakatau Readiness, and Mana Motuhake in the Workplace — an immersive, applied experience that stays with participants.

workshops.name: Indigenous Wellbeing Through a Clothing & Fashion Lens
workshops.description: Explore holistic wellbeing through fashion and clothing while incorporating Māori values of wairua, whānau, hinengaro and tinana. Reflect, connect and create practical tools for balanced living.
workshops.audience: HR leaders, social services practitioners, local councils

workshops.name: Māori Bread Experience
workshops.description: An authentic hands‑on cultural workshop learning to create, nurture and cook traditional Māori bread. Explore whakapapa, connection and teamwork through shared kai and storytelling in a marae kitchen.

workshops.name: The Treaty & The Integrity of Water
workshops.description: Interactive experience that explores how Te Tiriti and water share intertwined whakapapa, expressing life, authority and balance, and how that relationship shapes whenua, people and environments.
workshops.audience: Engineers, infrastructure, civil and local councils

workshops.name: Personal Development & Team Building Day (Marae)
workshops.description: Reflective marae‑based workshop for senior and executive leaders to explore identity, leadership and service through cultural immersion and lived experience, translating insights into measurable workplace change.

workshops.name: End‑of‑Year Christmas Party (Marae)
workshops.description: Festive marae‑based, alcohol‑free end‑of‑year experience with kai, waiata, storytelling and cultural protocols to celebrate achievements, strengthen relationships and give back to the local community.

workshops.name: Understanding Technology & AI (Entry Level)
workshops.description: Build foundational digital literacy and AI awareness for team members at any experience level. Introduces key concepts, practical applications and ethical considerations in plain language.
workshops.audience: Small business owners, startups, admin teams

workshops.name: AI & Prompt / Context Engineering - Level 1
workshops.description: Master prompt design strategies, refinement techniques and best practices for communicating effectively with AI systems to achieve reliable, high‑quality outputs.
workshops.audience: Small business owners, startups, admin teams

workshops.name: AI & Social Media — Level 1
workshops.description: Harness AI tools to enhance social media strategy, content creation and audience engagement, covering AI‑powered analytics, content generation and platform optimisation techniques.
workshops.audience: Small business owners, startups, marketing teams

workshops.name: AI & Cyber Security — Level 1
workshops.description: Introductory cyber security principles to protect data, systems and reputation from digital threats. Focuses on reducing risk, strengthening resilience and maintaining trust.

workshops.name: AI & Automation in the Workplace
workshops.description: Practical approaches to streamline repetitive tasks, remove bottlenecks and boost efficiency using AI automation — helping SMEs gain time, accuracy and scalability.
workshops.audience: Small business owners, startups, admin teams

workshops.name: AI Train the Trainers
workshops.description: A train‑the‑trainer programme to rapidly upskill staff, scale knowledge, standardise quality and create ongoing capability within organisations.

workshops.name: AI Audits & Diagnostics
workshops.description: A tailored organisational diagnostic revealing cultural and operational strengths and gaps, giving leaders unfiltered insight into what works and where people and performance can grow.

workshops.name: Twelve Week Unity Series
workshops.description: A progressive twelve‑week cohort programme with tailored sessions and feedback touchpoints that applies kotahitanga leadership principles and includes a half‑day marae visit to embed commercial and cultural ROI.
workshops.audience: Universities, tertiary providers, enterprise and SME cohorts

workshops.name: Te Tiriti Through a Global Health Lens
workshops.description: Interactive workshop exploring Te Tiriti and its public health relevance, led by international Indigenous health leadership to deepen cultural insight and policy relevance.
workshops.audience: Senior leaders, public health professionals, environmental teams, policy advisors

workshops.name: Tailored & Customisable Multi‑Year Programmes
workshops.description: Bespoke multi‑year programmes designed to embed cultural capability and commercial outcomes across organisations. Fully customisable scope, timing and measurement frameworks.
